intro: Meniscium turrialbae, commonly known as the Turrialba meniscium, is a flowering plant native to the cloud forests of Costa Rica. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of its family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found at high elevations. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
